meanings.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one disintegration per second.
meanings.sent1: She measured the radioactivity in the lab using becquerels.
meanings.sent2: The Geiger counter detected ten becquerels of radiation.
meanings.sent3: The becquerels in the experiment were so low, they barely registered on the scale.
meanings.sent4: The becquerels in the sample were like tiny ticking time bombs.
meanings.sent5: The becquerels glowed ominously in the dark room.

meanings.definition: The International System unit of radioactivity, equal to one disintegration per second.
meanings.sent1: The scientist calculated the radiation levels in becquerels.
meanings.sent2: The nuclear power plant emitted thousands of becquerels of radiation.
meanings.sent3: The becquerels in the radioactive waste were carefully monitored.
meanings.sent4: The becquerels in the air seemed to hum with energy.
meanings.sent5: The becquerels danced on the screen of the radiation detector.
